intro: Satureja inodora, commonly known as mountain savory, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the Lamiaceae family, characterized by its square stems and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features small, tubular flowers that are usually pink or purple in color. Its leaves are lance-shaped and emit a strong, peppery fragrance when crushed. Satureja inodora is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported digestive and anti-inflammatory properties.
